metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2105 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate function in crypto/evp/encode.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of binary data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1').
